content:
Hello there We have read that message. We try to help.

Some of the reminders are not visible.

It might be time to check for some settings : Enable reminders Set reminders. Show missed reminders. Check for updates for that calendar . Be shure thane that calendar settings are not hidden. Having calendar extensions?check for their updates.
creator: Googlethunderbird.

content:
Hello there


Other fix for that reminders ain’t there.

Got o view > calendar>Calendar pane>Calendar list>Activate it.

If that calendar is locked right click on that calendar select properties then uncheck the read only box that appears there. It might be solved now.

Be sure that there are no other calendars. Delete them if possible.



Greetings google Thunderbird.
creator: Googlethunderbird.

content:
Sorry but none of these answers worked except they did put me in the right location.

Checking all the settings I noticed my old email address was still listed in Calendar Properties. I just decided to change it to my new address. I have been using this new address for over 3 years. The problem with reminders started just 7 days ago. Must be due to an update of something. I know Thunderbird only updated sometime since Friday. I don't have any addons.

Anyway it is sorted.

creator: Arbuthnot

content:
Should have been more specific.

I changed my email address in my Mozilla settings online. I had quite a search to find where this is done.

When logged into Mozilla do a search for "Change the primary email address on your Mozilla account".

Also go to Thunderbird Settings/Calendar and make sure the box for "Show missed reminders for writable calendars" is checked.
creator: Oldneweng

content:
The latter part "Show missed reminders for writable calendars" was suggested previously elsewhere, and I found it unchecked, on ticking the box, closing and reopening Thunderbird all the old reminders came up, so thought it had cured the problem but next time of opening, nothing, no reminders, all I am getting at present is one reminder I set a few days ago, one other comes up daily but disappears without my dismissing it

As to changing the primary address I am none the wiser, searching as you suggest in Help from Thunderbird came up with nothing useful, tried the Help from Firefox (which I assumed would be the same but no) it came up with a few but there has never been a connection or difference as far as I am aware, I use my main email for TB and another for most other things such as this Mozilla help

It has never been an issue before so why now?, TB is working as it should, but Lightning isn't, what would be the connection between Lightning and Mozilla support/help? or am I missing something obvious?

So I am loath to change the Mozilla log on email address to my main email address unless theres a good reason to do so
creator: Arbuthnot

content:
What I said was "I changed my email address in my Mozilla settings online". Not Thunderbird. Not Firefox. MOZILLA ONLINE.

Please reads this slowly and carefully "When logged into Mozilla do a search for Change the primary email address on your Mozilla account". That is a direct copy of what I wrote. I really hate it when people have preconceived ideas and don't bother to actually read what is written.

This is online, in your Mozilla online account. Online and Mozilla web account. I thought that would be clear. You are not making changes on your computer! You are making changes on your Mozilla web account.

So, go online, log into your Mozilla account (online) and then type the search line I wrote, into the Mozilla Search box (online).

This is how I changed my email address in the Mozilla Online Account. Whether this is what you need to do I have no idea. I am just clarifying what I did. The address change may have had nothing to do with the original problem.
creator: Oldneweng

content:
Well thank you Mr Angry ;-)

It seems you don't read replies either, I asked what connection there would be between a Mozilla log in email and Thunderbird/Lightning?

As far as I can see, none

I also explained why I am loath to change the email address used for Mozilla, keeping a separate email address for all and sundry keeps spam to a minimum

Until this update Lightning calendar reminders worked as expected, now they don't, so something in that update has caused this, I am not the only one with the same problem, I cannot see a connection between a Mozilla log in email to Lightning all of a sudden stopping working

PS I was logged into Mozilla when I did the search
creator: Arbuthnot

content:
You asked where to find the email address change location. "but nowhere can I find calendar properties to check email address, where is it?" (Quote from your first post)

I simply told you where it was. What you do with this information has nothing to do with me. You asked where it was and I told you. The email address connected to the calendar is set in your Mozilla online account settings.

You complained

"It seems you don't read replies either, I asked what connection there would be between a Mozilla log in email and Thunderbird/Lightning?"

Read the last paragraph of my previous post. Take note of "I have no idea". Does that give you some idea of how much I know about what you wanted answered? I believe I did answer you.

You still cannot find where this email change can be made?

While typing this post, I alt / clicked on Mozilla Support (above). In the new tab I copied my search term "Change the primary email address on your Mozilla account". First result of 30 was the right one. Click on it and full instructions are given.

Other than this I have no further information or knowledge that can assist you. Like you I an just a user trying to find answers.
creator: Oldneweng

content:
Thank you again for your input

I have been a Thunderbird user since Outlook Express ended, must be some 15 or 20 years ago, thankfully I have rarely had a problem (which are thankfully rare in themselves) I couldn't solve myself

I am well aware these forums are user to user, so even more reason to be polite to each other wouldn't you say?

Its a pity Mozilla don't have a help itself but understandable

As a PS to my previous posts re missing reminders, one reminder recently set comes up every time still, others do not, even newly set reminders, last night at approx 6:30pm, without even touching the keyboard, up sprang the reminders for that day, the day to come and the day before, I thought something must have been found and changed in Thunderbird or Lightning, but no, this morning back to normal, just that one stubborn reminder

So its still not resolved, hopefully Mozilla will fix the problem sometime?

content: You need to provide more info to get specifics, but here is the concept: if the account is IMAP, they will automatically appear. If the account was POP, messages from a prior installation will be (normally) in the Mail\<POPaccount> folder in the old profile. With some specifics, I can provide more details.
creator: davidsk

content:
1. Press the Alt key, then click View > Toolbars > Menu Bar.

2. The panel below the list of email files will show the email you select from the list above. If you don't want that, pressing F8 will get rid of that panel.

creator: JamesJ

content: Here's a screen shot of the toolbar.
creator: JamesJ

content:
It is called "Message Header Toolbar Customize". It is still available and it works with Thunderbird 140.0.

Tools (menu) > Add-ons & Themes" or the three-line icon > Add-ons & Themes. Then search for "Message Header Toolbar Customize".

There is a way to remove that toolbar using CSS, which is quite simple. https://superuser.com/questions/1802457/thunderbird-remove-icons-reply-forward-archive-from-message-header-toolb
creator: mozilla98

content: The add-on is called Message Header Toolbar Customize. Note, there is no such thing as a 'message body toolbar'. You need the version 2.4.4 with the date Apr 07, 2025 if you are using a version of TB more recent than 136. You can download it here. https://hogi.sakura.ne.jp/en/downloadcgi.rhtml?msghdrcust

content:
Go to the Thunderbird menu and go to Settings. In the left-hand pane, find & click on 'Composition'

Within the Composition section, you'll find settings spellcheck that will apply globally to your account.

  • Check spelling before sending
  • Enable spellcheck as you type

Hope this helped you!

content: Problem solved: the ssl chain file was not installed for domain1. Other email clients apparently don't pay attention to this, but Thunderbird wants everything set up as it should be.

content:
If you're setting the display fonts in Settings/General/Language & Appearance, Advanced..., with Fonts for: Latin and Fonts for: Other Writing Systems, the Size is in pixels. For fonts embedded in composed messages, it's best to leave the settings at defaults. To convert points to pixels:

https://pixelsconverter.com/px-to-pt
creator: sfhowes

content:
Here’s what I tried after posting:

  • I fully closed Thunderbird and launched it via the Profile Manager using thunderbird.exe -p
  • I selected the existing profile default-release (which maps to the 7GB folder zfu3t99k.default-release) — but Thunderbird still starts fresh, as if the profile is empty.
  • I also created a new profile via the Profile Manager, manually pointing it to the zfu3t99k.default-release folder. Same result — Thunderbird starts blank, with no accounts or emails.
  • I tried editing profiles.ini to make sure it points only to zfu3t99k.default-release, marked it as Default, and removed any Locked=1 line — still no luck.

So it seems Thunderbird sees the profile folder, but won’t load or recognize the data in it.

Any advice would be greatly appreciated!
creator: hubchau

content:
See https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1978361

Have you tried removing the entries for the account from Saved Passwords in Settings, restarting TB, and entering a new secure mail key generated on the AT&T site, when asked for a password?

https://www.att.com/support/article/dsl-high-speed/KM1010523/
creator: sfhowes

content:
Thank you for the link I'll let them know I am seeing the same problem.

I have not tried your / their suggestion of removing the entries for the account from Saved Passwords in Settings, restarting TB, and entering a new secure mail key generated on the AT&T site, when asked for a password since that would break the other 2 working email clients.

All settings are correct according to the other link and I had also compared to what I have on the laptop.
creator: josephd.henderson

content: The phone's mail app probably accepts the regular account password, and it's my understanding a secure mail key is for desktop mail apps, and a separate key is required for each desktop app, or for each computer that has the same account. So, using a new key for TB on a desktop shouldn't affect the account on the laptop.
